titleStmt.title: The jolly gentleman's frolick: or, The city ramble. Being, an account of a young gallant, who wager'd to pass any of the watches, without giving them an answer; but being stop'd by the constable at Cripple-gate, was sent to the counter, afterwards had before my lord mayor, and was clear'd by the intercession of my lord mayor's daughter. To a pleasant new tune.

The jolly gentleman's frolick: or, The city ramble. Being, an account of a young gallant, who wager'd to pass any of the watches, without giving them an answer; but being stop'd by the constable at Cripple-gate, was sent to the counter, afterwards had before my lord mayor, and was clear'd by the intercession of my lord mayor's daughter. To a pleasant new tune.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C[harles]. Bates, at the White-Hart in West-Smithfield.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Give your ear to a frolicksome ditty ..."
Date, place of publication and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
